greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Lexicographically earliest sequence such that a(i) = a(j) => f(i) = f(j), where f(n) = [A003557(n), A046523(n), A048250(n)].
comment: Restricted growth sequence transform of A291752.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..100000
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ From A046523
A048250(n) = if(n<1, 0, sumdiv(n, d, if(core(d)==d, d)));
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 19 2017
ext: Name changed and the comments section added by _Antti Karttunen_, Jul 13 2019
